page.title: 18Mining In Callington
page.content: { East Cornwall}was one of the most {important mineral mining areas}in the world in the nineteenth century. Mining died and mines fell into disuse when the price of tin slumped. In the late 70s world mineral prices rose and mining companies started to prospect new lodes around old mines again. In the Callington area, {Southwest Minerals}chose sites at{Haye {South, Blogsters and Redmoor mines}to prospect. By the early eightes people became used to seeing mining machinery coming into the locality. In 1985 Redmoor took the most promising prospect. Under the{managing directorship of Mr. {Gerald Pengelly.}South-West continue to peospect with a view to mining in the future.
